name: Amiga Formatted Disk Image
summary: Learn about .FDI files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Commodore produced the Amiga line of computers in the 1980s and 90s. Amiga users created floppy disk images saved in various formats, including the .ADF, .ADZ, and .DMS formats. In 2000, developer Vincent Joguin created the FDI disk image format, to make sharing data between Amiga users easier.

The FDI format is open-source, so most Amiga emulators can mount FDI disk images and access the data they contain. Also, unlike other Amiga disk images, FDI files can store raw low-level data, such as data required to support copy protection schemes. As such, FDI files are often larger than other Amiga disk images.

instructions: You can open an FDI file with Amiga emulators such as Cloanto Amiga Forever (multiplatform), WinUAE (Windows), and E-UAE (Mac, Linux).

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
